Item, Tente xlv acras i perticam terre arabilis in duobus campis, unde in campo Orientali in Medelynfurl unam acram, in Bunnsehmerefurl di∣mid. acre, in Pypelakefurl i acram tribus pertica∣tis in duabus particulis, in Longfurl dimidium acre, in Chowdewellfurl unam acram, subtus villam unam acram Bytwyne Wayes i acram, apud Bessells unam acram, in Heggeendfurl dimi∣dium acre, super La Wayte dimidium acre, de∣supper Les Graffecombs dimidium acre, in Rygge∣weyfurl unam acram i perticam in duabus parti∣culis,
in Horslade unam acram in duabus particu∣lis. Item, Ibid. i perticam super Hye Dyche, i acram in duabus particulis, in Threthornefurl ii acras in tribus particulis, in Crowndewell unam acram in duabus particulis, in Odehyllfurl unam acram in duabus particulis, in Downeendfurl i acram in duabus particulis, in Oldeburyfurl unam acram in duabus particulis, in Brodepann ii acras in tribus particulis, in Longstonefurl unam acram, in Blakelond dimidium acre.

Et in campo Occidentali in Flexelondfurl dimidi∣um acre, in Ryshcole i perticam, in Westetowne∣furl dimidium acre, subtus La Brandyron dimi∣dium acre, desuper Les Combes unam acram, in [Fol. 122.] La Heggeend unam acram in duabus particulis, in Edcomb unam acram, subtus Rygge∣wey unam acram, desuper Ryggewey unam acram dimidium in duabus particulis, in Redelond unam acram, in Ledfurl ii acras in duabus particulis, in Hye Dychefurl unam acram in duabus particu∣lis, desuper La Ledde dimidium acre, in Woofurl unam acram, in Stubthornefurl dimidium acre, in Fflyntfurl dimidium acre, apud Odehyll unam per∣ticam, in Brechelond quatuor acras. Item, Ibi∣dem quinque acras, & ulterius arabit cariabit oferna & bladum & queret victualia in mercato, cariabit boscum, cariabit victualia Domini ad Pontem de Stanys, ut in custumar. & cum obie∣rit dabit Domino herietam.

ROBERTUS HORTONN, senior,These two Words within Crochets are struck out. [natus Dni] These two next Words are added over the expunged Words in the Original MS. habet manumissionem, tenet unum Messua∣gium
& ii virgatas tere in Edwynstonn, unde Messuagium curtillagium & gardinum continent ii perticate dimidium.

Item, Tenet decem acras tres perticas, i swath. prati in communibus pratis, unde in Wykehill in inferiori parte ibidem ii # acras, in Prydenn quatuor # acras, in North-Mede dimidium acre, in Chepeacre # unam acram, in La Morys unam acram, i perticam in tribus particulis. Item, Tenet i swath. ibidem, apud Twelfeacres unam acram, in Hen-Mede i acram. Item, Tenet xliiii acras terre arabilis in duobus campis, unde in campo Orientali in Twentylond unam acram di∣mid. in duabus particulis, in Lakefurl unam acram, subtus Villam unam acram i perticatam in duabus particulis, apud Choldewell unam acram, in Les Tenacres iii perticas, Bythwene∣wayes tres acras in quatuor particulis, apud Bas∣sets unam acram. Item, Ibidem unam acram, apud Quarrefurl dimidium acre, apud Graffe∣comb dimidium acre, desuper Graffecomb unam acram in duabus particulis, in Ryggewey unam acram dimidium in duabus particulis, apud Horslade unam acram, apud Hye-Dyche dimidium acre, in Threthornefurl dimidium acre, in Grend∣well unam acram, in Froggepann dimidium acre, in Odehyll tres perticas in duabus particulis, in Oldeburyfurl unam acram i perticam in duabus particulis, in Longecuppe quatuor acras, in Blake∣londs unam acram, in Buttelerscomb unam acram.

Et in campo Occidentali apud Brandyron unam acram in duabus particulis, subtus Villam unam acram. Item, Ibidem iii perticas in duabus particulis, in Ruysheacre unam acram, desuper Marewell dimidium acre, apud Heggeend unam
acram, in Meryfurl dimidium acre, apud La Wayte unam perticam, in Edcomb unam acram dimidium in duabus particulis. in Ryggeweyfurl i acram, apud Ryggeweybuyshe dimidium acre, in Seynt Katherynfurl ii acras in tribus particulis, apud Cottsbuyshe tres acras dimidium, in Ledfurl i acram, subtus Odehyll unam acram dimidium in duabus particulis, in Fflyntfurl unam acram in duabus particulis, apud Ffawkennersbuysh dimi∣dium acre, & ulterius lanabit & tondebit biden∣tes Domini, &c. & cum obierit dabit Domino herietam.
[Fol. 123.] THOMAS PROWTE, Vicarius de Ayshbury, tenet unum Messuagium & unam vir∣gatam terre in Edwynstonn, unum Messuagium cum curtillagio & gardino continent dimidium acre.
Item, Tenet unam acram tribus perticis prati in Les Morys uno anno, & in secundo anno unam acram dimidium & i swath. & tunc Ricar∣dus Eyre habet unam perticam de tribus perticis predictis.

Item, Tenet xix acras terre arabilis in duobus campis, unde in campo Orientali in Basynshmere dimidium acre, in Lakefurl dimidium acre, subtus Villam ibidem unam acram in tribus par∣ticulis, in Choldewell dimidium acram, in Crosse∣furl unam acram, desuper Bassets dimidium acre, apud Le Quarre i perticam, desuper La Combs dimidium acre, apud La Wayte tres perticas, apud Ryggewey dimidium acre, in Horslade dimi∣dium acre, in Hye Dyche i perticam, in Grenden∣way tres perticas, in Odehyll tres perticas in duabos particulis, apud Downende i perticam, in Oldeburyfurl dimidium acre, in Froggepann ii
perticas dimid. in duabus particulis, in Marle∣hay dimidium pertice.

Et in campo Occidentali apud Flexelond i perticam, in Marrewelfurl unam acram, apud Sydeldon dimidium acre in duabus particulis, in Meryfurl dimidium acre, in Edcomb dimidium acre, apud La Wayte tres acras in duabus parti∣culis, apud Ryggewey tres perticas in duabus par∣ticulis, apud Hye-Dyche i acram in duabus par∣ticulis, subtus Ledde dimidium acre, in Odehyll i perticam, in Brechelond i acram, & ulterius la∣nabit & tondebit Domini, &c. & cum obierit dabit domino heriettam.

Item, Idem tenet unum cotagium cum curtil∣lagio in Ayshbury vocatum Domerhmershe, unde cur∣tillagium & croftum continens tres perticas Do∣mini. Item, tenet vi acras terre arabilis in Kynge∣stonnfyld in tribus particulis de Overlond.

CLEMENS NORTH, Tenet unum toftum & dimidium virgate terre cum molendino aquatico blad. jam dinast. vocatum Darks, unde curtilla∣gium cum crosto annexo continens unam acram dimidium pertice, & aliud crostum in australi parte tenementi sui continens unam acram. Item, tenet tres acras & i damiam prati in com∣munibus pratis unde in Chepacre unam acram, in Twelfeacre unam acram, & in North-Mede i damiam prati, in Westemedebuysh unam acram. Item, tenet pasturam ad vi vaccas in La Mershe. Item, Pasturam duarum viarum ibidem unde i jacet in Occidentali parte per longitudinem voc. inter ii molendina, & aliam viam in campis ibidem vocatam Darkslane. Item, tenet ii lanshe∣ras in Darksfeld, ibidem in Les Broks. Item, tenet duodecim acras i perticam dimid. terre
arabilis in ii campis, unde in campo Orientali in Olond unam acram, in La Heele dimidium pertice, in Olond dimidium pertice, in Darksfeld duas acras in duabus particulis, in occidentali parte de Darks duas acras, desuper Brokefurl unam acram, juxta Wheleacre dimidium pertice.

Et in campo occidentali in Middlefurl unam acram, apud Whytecrosse i acram, apud Heggeend unam acram, in Cobbuttshurl unam acram, in Ruggeweyfurlong unam acram, in campo de Kyngestonn unam acram, & ulterius lanabit & tondebit bidentes Domini, & cum obierit dabit Domino heriettam.

[Fol. 124.] THOMAS COPER, tenet unum Messuagium & unam virgatam terre in Edwyn∣stonn, unde curtillagium cum gardino continet dimid. acre. Item, idem tenet unum toftum cum curtillagio continens dimidium pertice & octo Lugguacor. Item, idem tenet x acras i perticam & i swath. prati unde in Mora i acram i perticam in tribus particulis. Item, ibidem i swath. in Henmede unam # acram, in Chepe∣mede unam acram, in Henmede unam acram, in Wykehill # i lhuyte cont. vi acras. Item, tenet xxxii acras i perticam dimid. terre arabilis in duobus campis, unde in campo Orientali in Twentylondfurl ii acras dimid. in tribus particulis, in Lakefurl dimidium acre, in Lattewelfurl ii acras dimid. pertice, desuper Longfurl tres per∣ticas in tribus particulis. Item, in Longfurl i acram dimid. in tribus particulis, in Chowde∣welfurl dimidium acre, in Tenacrefurl tres perti∣cas in duabus particulis, apud Bessells dimidium acre, apud Heggeendfurl unam acram, in Whyte∣furl tres perticas in duabus particulis, in Graffe∣combfurl
unam acram, desuper Ryggawey dimi∣dium acre, in Horselade dimidium acre, in Hy-Dyche tres perticas in duabus particulis, in Thre∣thornefurl dimidium acre, in Froggepann ii acras in quatuor particulis, in Odehyll dimidium acre, in Downefurlongende unam perticam, & in campo occidentali in Flexelond unam acram, in Heleforgh ii acras dimid. in quatuor particulis, in Sytells∣downe tres perticas in duabus particulis, in Heggeendfurl unam acram, in Meryful dimidium acre in duabus particulis, apud La Quarre unam acram, in Odcomb unam acram, in Ryggeweyfurl i perticam. Item, ibidem i acram dimid. in duabus particulis, in Redlonds unam acram, di∣mid. in tribus particulis, in Woofurl ii acras di∣mid. in tribus particulis, in Odehyll dimidium acre in duabus particulis, in Hye-Dyche dimidi∣um acre, subtus La Ledde dimidium acre, apud Ryggeweybuysh limilium acre, & ulterius lanabit & tondebit bidentes Domini cum vicinis suis, &c. & cum obierit dabit Domino heriettam.
EDWARDUS HORTON, natus Domini tenet unum Messuagium in Edwynstonn, & unarm vir∣gatam terre, ac toftum alterius virgate terre ibidem unde curtillagium continens insimul unam acram.

Item, tenet octo acras, & i swath. prati in communibus pratis unde in Wykehyll i lhuyte contin. sex acras, in North. Mede dimidium acre, in La More unam acram i perticam & i swath. in quatuor particulis, in Rychemera unam perti∣cam. Item, tenet xlii acras i perticam dimid. terre arabilis in duobus campis, unde, in campo Orientali in Lakefurl unam acram in duabus par∣ticulis, in Fiveakers i acram, in Longfurl unam
acram in duabus particulis, in Lortewellfurl unam acram in duabus particulis, apud Choldwell ii acras dimid. In Teneakers dimidium acre, By∣twynewayes unam acram in duabus particulis, subtus Villam ibidem i perticam, in Grascomb di∣midium acre. Item, ibidem i stich, apud Bes∣sells dimidium acre, desuper La Comb dimidium acre, in Ruggewayfurl unam acram, in Horslade unam acram in duabus particulis, super La Wayte i perticam, desuper Ruggeway dimidium acre, super Hye-Dyche i acram, apud Grend-wyll unam acram in duabus particulis, in Threthornefurl i acram in duabus parciculis, super Odehyll ii acras in tribus particulis, apud Downeend dimid. acram, apud Oldeburyfurl tres perticas in duabus parti∣culis, super Oldebury tres acras, in Froggepanne unam acram i perticatam.

Et in campo Occidentali in Flexelend i acram i perticam in duabus particulis, in Holeforgh unam acram dimid. in duabus particulis, super Sydells∣downe dimidium acre, in Meryfurl tres perticas in duabus particulis, in Edcomb i acram, in Seynt Katerynfurl i perticam, in Redelond unam acram in duabus particulis, in Woolond ii acras, apud Stubthorne i acram, in Flyntefurl ii acras in duabus particulis, super Odehyll unam acram, in Gryndwyll dimidium acre, super Hye-Dyche di∣midium acre, apud Collsbuysh unam acram, apud Ruggewey is buyshe unam acram, in Brechelond # quatuor acras, & ulterius lanabit & tonde∣bit bidentes Domini cum vicinis suis, & cum obierit dabic Domino ii heriettas.
[Fol. 125.] JOHANNA THECCHER, vidua de Edwynstonn, tenet unum Messuagium & unam virgatam terre unde curtillagium continet unam perticatam.

Item, Idem tenet toftum alterius virgate er ibid. contin. dimid. acre, octo acras tres perticas & i swath. prati in communibus pratis unde in Wykehull ii partes unius lhuyte cont. quatuor acras per pretium annuum xii d. in North-Mede dimidium acre in duabus particulis, in Mora unam acram, unam perticam in tribus particu∣lis. Item, ibidem i swath. in Henmede ii acras in duabus particulis, apud Medeyate unam acram. Item, tenet lii acras tres perticas terre arabilis in duobus campis, unde in campo Orientali in Twentylondfurl quatuor acras in duabus particu∣lis, desuper Batynshmere dimid. acre, in Lakefurl unam acram dim. in australi parte ejusdem di∣midium acre, in Longfurl unam acram dimidi∣um pertice in duabus particulis, in Teneacres di∣midium acre, Bytwynewayes unam acram, in Heggeendfurl ii acras dimid. in tribus particulis, desuper La Combs unam acram in duabus parti∣culis, supper La Wayte i acram dimid. super Rugge∣way tres acras in tribus particulis, apud Rugge∣wayesbuyshe dimidium acre, in Horslade ii acras in duabus particulis, super Hye-Dyche unam acram tres perticas in tribus particulis, in Threthorne∣furl dimidium acre, super Odehyll tres acras in quatuor particulis, apud Downeendfurl unam acram in duabus particulis, in Oldeburyfurl unam acram in duabus particulis, in Froggpanne unam acram & dimidium pertice. Et in campo Occi∣dentali in Flexelond unam acram, unam perticam in tribus particulis, in Holeforgh it acras in tri∣bus particulis, in Ruyshaker i perticam, super Sydellesdonn unam acram, desuper La Comb ii acras dimid. in Edcomb unam acram, unam per∣ticam in duabus particulis, in australi parte de
Ruggewayfurl ii acras in tribus particulis in Red∣lond, unam acram in duabus particulis, in Seynt Kateryn is furl dimid. acram, in Olond unam acram, apud Collsbuysh unam acram, subtus Les Leedes ii acras dimid. in tribus particulis, super Les Leede unam acram in duabus particulis, in Ofurl dimid. acram, in Flyntfurl dimidium acre, super Odebill unam acram in duabus particulis, in Grendewyll i acram, in occidentali parte de Weste-Horslade ii acras apud Ruggewaybuyshes i acram, super La Wayte unam acram dimid. & ulterius lanabit & tondebit bidentes Domini, & cum obierit dabit Domino ii herietta.

ROBERTUS BOVETOWNN, natus Domini, tenet unum Messuagium & dimidium virgate terre, in Edwynstonn unde curtillagium & gar∣dinum continent unam perticam dimid. Item, Idem tenet unum toftum vocatum Cotehous, unum curtillagium continens dimidium acre. Item, tenet quinque acras prati in communibus pratis, unde in Henmede tres acras in tribus par∣ticulis, unde unam acram de Overland, & in Wykehyll terciam partem unius lhuyte prati con∣tin. ii acras per precium viii d. Item, Idem tenet xxii acras tres perticas terre arabilis in duobus campis unde in campo Orientali in Twentylondfurl quatuor acras in tribus particulis, in Medeyate∣furl unam acram dimid. in duabus particulis de∣super Villam unam acram, apud Le Quarre di∣mid. acram, apud Heggeendfurl dimidium acram, in Ryggeweyfurl ii acras in duabus particulis, apud Hye-Dyche unam acram, in Froggepann unam acram dimid. in duabus particulis, in Ode∣byll unam perticatam. Et in campo Occidentali in Flexelondfurl unam acram in duabus particulis,
in [Fol. 126.] Holeforgh unam acram, apud Sydeltonn unam acram, in Ledcomb unam acram, desuper Ruggewey unam acram, subtus La Ledde unam acram, apud Hye-Dyche unam acram di∣mid. in duabus particulis, in Woofurl ii acras, in Flyntefurl unam acram, & ulterius lanabit & tondebit bidentes Domini, & cum obierit dabit Domino ii heriettas.

JOHANNES BESSELEY, de Ayshbury, tenet unum Messuagium & unam virgatam terre, unde curtillagium, gardinum & pomerium contin. i perticam dimid. & in clauso annexo unam acram dimidium perticate. Item, tenet tres acras, dimidium pertice prati in communi∣bus pratis, unde in Wylleshmere tres acras, & in North-Mede dimidium pertice. Item, tenet xxvi acras tres perticatas terre arabilis in duobus campis, unde in campo Orientali in Woolond di∣midium acre. Item, ibidem unam perticam in Darkesfeld unam acram, unam perticam in du∣abus particulis, in occidentali parte De Darks unam acram, desuper La Broke unam acram, in Whytelond unam acram, super La Wayte unam acram, in La Breche quatuor acras, apud La Quarre tres acras #. Et in campo Occidentali juxta Droveend tres pertica in Hillefurl unam acram, desuper Whytecrosse unam acram, super La Wayte ii acras, in Cobbelfurl i acram, in Rugge∣lond unam acram, in campo de Kyngestonn sex acras, in campo de Yedstonn unam acram, & ulterius lanàbit & tondebit bidentes Domini & dabit heriettam.

WILLIELMUS TAYLOR, de Ayshbury, tenet unum Messuagium, & unam virgatam terre, unde curtillagium & gardinum continent ii per∣ticas
dimid. Item, tenet tres acras prati in com∣munibus pratis unde in Wylle&s;hmere dimidiam acram, in La Hivea dimidiam acram, & in West-Mede ii acras. Item, tenet octodecim acras dimid. terre arabilis in duobus campis, unde in campo Orientali in Woolond unam acram in qua∣tuor particulis, in Darksfeld. ii acras tres perticas in quatuor particulis, desuper Darks dimidiam acram, in occidentali parte de Darks unam per∣ticam, super La Wayte unam acram, in Rugge∣wayfurl dimidium acre, desuper Ruggeway unam acram, apud Baroghes unam acram, in campo de Kyngestonn unam acram, apud Ruggewayes∣buysh dimidium acre. Et in campo Occidentali, apud Standbrugge unam acram, desuper Lortewyll dimidium acre, apud Bessells dimidium acre, de∣super Graffecomb dimidiam acram, super La Wayte unam acram, in Cobbewellfurl tres acras, super La Wayte in campo de Edwynstonn ii acras in tribus particulis, in Ruggewayfurl dimidium acre. Et ulterius lanabit & tondbit bidentes Domini, & cum obierit dabit Domino he∣riettam.

RICARDUS COWBOROWE, de Ayshbury, tenet unum Messuagium & unam virgatam terre, unde curtillagium & gardinum continent ii per∣ticas dimid. Item, tenet duas acras ii perticas dimid. prati in communibus pratis, unde in Bo∣reali parte [Fol. 127.] Wylleshmere unam acram, in Wylleshmere unam acram, in North-Mede di∣midium pertice juxta Blyndelake unam stich. apud Wykebull dimidiam acram. Item, tenet xxii acras terre arabilis in duobus campis, unde in campo Orientali in Woolond tres perticas di∣mid. in duabus particulis, in Darksfeld duas acras
& dimidium pertice in quatuor particulis, in occi∣dentali parte de Darks dimidium acre, in Wayte∣lond duas acras in duabus particulis, apud Bare∣thornefurl unam acram, super La Whyte unam acram in duabus particulis, desuper Ruggeway duas acras dimid. in duabus particulis, in Grene∣barowefurl dimidium acre, in occidentali parte de Bollends dimidium acre, & in campo Occiden∣tali in Middelfurl unam acram in duabus parti∣culis, in Cobbyllfurl unam acram, super La Wayte duas acras dimid. in quatuor particulis in campo de Edwynstonn, super La Wayte unam acram, in Ruggewayfurl dimidium acre, in Rugge∣wayfurl de Ayshbury dimidium acre, apud Rugge∣weysbuysh unam acram, in Horsladefurl dimidium acre, apud Threthornefurl dimidium acre, in Hyllefurl duas acras, & ulterius lanabit & tonde∣bit bidentes Domini, & cum obierit dabit Do∣mino heriettam.

RICARDUS WATERHOUS, de Edwynstonn, tenet unum Messuagium & unam virgatam terre unde curtillagium & gardinum continent, dimi∣dium acre. Item, tenet quinque acras tres per∣ticas prati in communibus pratis, unde in North-Mede unam perticatam, in Twelveacre unam acram, in Les Mores dimidium acre, in Hen∣mede unam acram, in La Hivea tres acras. Item, tenet xxv acras tres perticas terre arabilis in du∣obus campis, unde in campo Orientali in Twen∣tylond dimidium acre, in Lortewellefurl duas acras in tribus particulis, in Tennacre unam acram, Bytwynewayes unam acram, desuper Buttelers∣comb dimid. acram, apud Heggeend unam acram, super La Wayte dimidium acre, in australi parte de Ruggewaye dimidium acre, in Horslade dimi∣dium
acre, in La Breche # quinque acras, super Hye-Dyche unam acram dimid. in duabus parti∣culis, in Oldebury dimidium acre. Et in campo Occidentali in Flexelond duas acras tres perticas in quatuor particulis, apud Brondere dimidium acre, subtus Villam unam acram, super Sydelsdonn duas acra, in australi parte de Ruggewaye unam acram, in Seynt Katerynisfurl dimidium acre, in Redlond unam acram, apud Collsbuysh unam acram, in australi parte de Les Leddes dimidium acre, in australi parte de Odehyll dimidium acre, super Hye-Dyche dimidium acre. Et ulterius corculabit, lanabit & tondebit bidentes Domi∣ni, & cum obierit dabit Domino heriettam.

WILLIELMUS ROBYNS, de Ayshbury, tenet unum Messuagium & dimidium virgate terre & toftum alterius dimid. virgate terre vocatum Pyperis unde curtillagium continet insimul di∣midiam acram. Item, Idem tenet novem acras tres perticas prati in communibus pratis unde in Henmede unam acram, in Wykehyll i lhuyte contin. sex acras, in Ryxedole dimidium pertice, in La Hivea dimidium pertice, in Chepeacre unam acram, apud La Chepehouse unam acram dimid. in duabus particulis.

[Fol. 128.] Item, Idem tenet xxi acras tres perticas terre arabilis in duobus campis, unde in campo Orientali in Woolond tres perticas in qua∣tuor particulis, in Darksfeld duas acras in quin∣que particulis, in occidentali parte de Darks unam acram in duabus particulis, apud Le Quarre duas acras dimid. in quatuor particulis, apud Heggeend unam acram, in Whytelond unam a cram dimid. in campo de Kyngestonn tres acras dimid. in quatuor particulis, in boreali parte de
Ruggeway dimidium acre, in australi parte ejus∣dem unam acram. Et in campo Occidentali super Bymellbuysh dimidium acre, apud Stond∣brugge duas acras in duabus particulis, in Hille∣furl unam acram, apud Whytecrosse unam perti∣cam, super La Wayte unam perticam. Item, Ibidem unam acram, in australi parte de Rugge∣waye duas acras in duabus particulis in boreali parte ejusdem dimidium acre, desuper Graffe∣comb dimidium acre, & ulterius lanabit & ton∣debit bidentes Domini, & cum obierit dabit Domino duo heriettas.

BARTHOLOMEUS FFRENSSH, de Edwynstonn, tenet unum Messuagium & unam virgatam terre unde curtillagium & gardinum continent ii per∣ticas dimid. Item, tenet quatuor acras unam. perticam dimid. & tres damias prati in commu∣nibus pratis unde in Wykehull unam perticam dimid. in Chepeacre unam acram, in Whelyshmere unam acram, in La Hivea duas acras & duas damias prati in North-Mede ac unam damiam prati in Brokehmere. Item, tenet xxi acras i perticam dimid. terre arabilis in duobus campis, unde in campo Orientali in Lakefurl unam acram in duabus particulis, in Fyveacre dimidium per∣tice, in Long furl dimidium acre, apud Cholde∣wellfurl dimidium acre, in Tenacre dimidium acre, desuper Les Bessells dimidium acre, desuper Buttelerescomb dimidium acre, desuper Graffcomb dimidium acre, super La Wayte dimidium acre, in Ruggewayfurl unam acram in duabus particu∣lis, in Esthorslade unam acram in duabus particu∣lis, super Hye-Dyche unam acram in duabus particulis, in Threthornefurl dimidiam acram, super Odehull unam acram in duabus particulis, in
Longstonefurl unam acram in duabus particulis, in Froggepanne unam acram in duabus particulis, in Blackelond dimidium acre, in Oldebury dimi∣dium acre. Et in campo Occidentali in Brondere∣furl unam acram in duabus particulis, apud Howndsford dimidium acre, in Marwellfurl dimi∣dium acre, apud Heggeend unam acram in dua∣bus particulis, in Ebcomb unam acram in duabus particulis, apud Ruggeway us buysh dimidium acre, apud Collsbuysh dimidium acre, super Odehyll di∣midiam acram, apud Stubbst horne unam acram in duabus particulis, in Flyntefurl dimidiam acram, in Swyndleyfurl duas acras, apud Fauke∣neresbuysh unam perticam. Et ulterius lanabit & tondebit bidentes Domini, & cum obierit da∣bit Domino heriettam.

THOMAS HORTONN, natus Domini, tenet unum Messuagium & unam virgatam terre, ac toftum unius dimid. virgate terre unde curtilla∣gium & gardinum continent insimul tres perti∣catas. Item, tenet toftum alterius virgate terre unde curtillagium arentatur per Robertum Horton per precium annuum viiid. ut patet postea & [Fol. 129.] unum clausum vocatum Sayleshmere continens unam acram, quolibet anno separa∣lem usque festum Sancti Petri ad Vincula. Item, tenet septem acras dimid. & i swath. prati in com∣munibus pratis, unde in Henmede, duas acras in Les Morys, in Twelfeacres duas acras, in Chepe∣acre duas acras, unde i de Overlond, in Wyvellesh∣mere i acram, in Wykehill unam perticam, & i swath. in North-Mede dimidium pertice. Item, in Wyvelleshmere dimidium perticate. Item, tenet liiii acras dimidium pertice terre arabilis in duobus campis, unde in campo Orientali in
Oldelonds unam acram duas perticas in duabus particulis, apud Oldelonds ibidem quinque butts contin dimidium acre, in Les Helys quatuor butts in quatuor particulis per estimacionem dimi∣dium acre, in Mershfurl unam acram in duabus particulis, in Hawcocks quatuor acras, in Say∣leshmere # quatuor acras in duabus particulis. Item, ibidem dimidium acre. Item, desuper La Broke unam acram dimid, in duabus particulis, apud Le Quarr duas acras in tribus particulis, in Badcomb dimidium acre, in Kyngestonfyld unam acram. Item, ibidem septem acras, in Grene∣barghfurl unam acram in duabus particulis, in parte australi de Ryggeway unam acram dimid. in tribus particulis, apud Copwayte dimidiam acram.

Et in campo Occidentali in Threthornfurl unam acram, in Burycroft unam acram, in Middlefurl dimidiam acre, in Burycroftstyle dimidium acre, apud Whytecrosse unam acram, unam perticam in duabus particulis, apud La Wayte in Les Whyte∣londs duas acras in tribus particulis. Item, ibidem unam acram dimid. in duabus particulis, in Lakefurl duas acras, in Ryggewayfurl duas acras in tribus particulis, desuper La Wayte unam per∣ticam dimid. in duabus particulis, in Horsladefurl tres perticas in duabus particulis, apud Rew∣thornes dimidium acre, apud Horsehill unam acram, super Odehyll unam perticam, apud Po∣plaryate unam acram, infra Warisherd duas acras, in Hillefurl unam acram, apud Orton is Hegge tres acras, in Kyngestonn is Combs duas acras, in Kyngestonn is Southfelds quatuor acras. Et ulteri∣us lanabit & tondebit bidentes Domini, & cum obierit dabit Domino tria heriettas.

ROBERTUS HORTONN, natus Domini, de Ayshbury, tenet unum Messuagium, & unam virgatam terre unde curtillagium, & crofta, & toftum unius dimid. virgate continent insimul duas acras unam perticam. Item, tenet curil∣lagium unius virgate vocatum Trayles nuper in tenura Thome Hortonn, continens i pertic. dimid. per pretium viiid. Item, tenet quinque acras tres perticas prati in communibus pratis unde in Wykehull unam acram, juxta La Yate ibidem ii swath. in Chepeacre unam acram, in La Hivea unam acram, in Ryxdoles dimidium acre, in su∣periori parte duas acras, in Brokehivea unam per∣ticam. Item, tenet xxxii acras dimid. terre ara∣bilis in duobus campis, unde in campo Orientali in Olond unam acram in sex particulis, in Darks∣feld unam acre dimid. in quatuor particulis, de∣super Darks tres perticas, in Hyllfurl unam acram, dimid. in duabus particulis, in Whytelond tres acras in tribus particulis, apud Le Quarr unam acram, super La Wayte dimidium acre, & in campo de Kyngestonn unam acram dimid. in duabus particulis, subtus Ruggeway unam perti∣cam, super La Wayte unam acram, in Rudlond unam acram, in Bolonds unam acram in duabus particulis, juxta Grenebarowe unam acram in duabus particulis. Et in campo Occidentali apud Brymylbuysh unam acram, in Middelfurl duas acras in quatuor particulis, in Hyllefurl unam acram dimid. in duabus particulis, & in campo [Fol. 120.] de Kyngestonn unam acram, apud Heggeend duas acras in duabus particulis, in Whytelond tres acras dimid. in tribus particulis, super Ruggeway unam acram dimid. in duabus particulis, in boreali parte de Ruggeway unam
acram dimidium, super La Wayte unam acram, in australi parte de Ruggeway duas acras in tribus particulis, apud Rewthorne dimidium acre. Et ulterius lanabit & tondebit bidentes Domini, & cum obierit dabit unam heriettam.

WILLIELMUS YONGE, de Ayshbury, tenet unum Messuagium; & unam virgatam terre unde curtillagium & gardinum continent dimi∣dium acre. Item, tenet alterum Messuagium & unam virgatam terre unde curtillagium conti∣net unam perticam dimid. Item, tenet octo acras unam perticam prati in communibus pratis unde in West-Mede unam acram, in Wylleshmere unam acram. Item, ibidem tres acras apud Chepe∣acre# unam acram. Item, ibidem unam acram, apud Shepehous unam acram, in Brokeshmres unam perticam. Item, tent xxxv acras, unam perticam terre arabilis in duobus campis, unde in campo Orientali in Olond unam acram, unam perticam in duabus particulis, in Darksfeld tres acras dimid in tribus particulis, in La Hurnes di∣midiam acram in Hillefurl unam acram dimid. in duabus particulis, in Whytelond juxta Le Quarr unam acram dimid. in duabus particulis, in campo de Kyngestonn unam perticam, super La Wayte dimidium acre, desuper Ruggeway unam acram, in La Breche quinque acras, in Mandell dimidium acre, in Middellfurl duas acras, juxta Ruggeway is buysh dimidium acre, subtus Rugge∣way unam acram, & in campo Occidentali in Horsladefurl unam acram dimid in duabus parti∣culis, desuper Ruggeway dimidium acre, in campo de Edwynstonn unam acram tres perticas in tribus particulis, in Lockelond duas acras in duabus particulis, subtus, Ruggeway unam acram,
in Graffecomb unam acram, desuper Graffecomb duas acras, in occidentali parte de Teneacres di∣midium acre, apud Lortewyll unam acram, in Whytelond unam acram, in Middelfurl unam acram dimid. in duabus particulis, in La Hurnes unam acram dimid. apud Merlehay in campo de Edwynstonn unam acram. Et ulterius lanabit & tondebit bidentes Domini, & cum obierit dabit Domino duas heriettas.

WILLIELMUS COLLYS, tenet unum Messu∣agium, & unam virgatam terre in Ayshbury, unde Messuagium cum curtillagio, & gardino continet duas perticas dimid. Item, tenet quin∣que acras duas perticas dimid. prati dimid. lhuyte # in Wykehyll cont. tres acras, in North-Mede # dimidium acre, apud Le Shepehouse unam acram, in West-Mede unam acram, in Ryxdole dimidium pertice. Item, tenet viginti acras dimid. terre arabilis in duobus campis unde in campo Orientali in Oldlond dimidium acre. Item, ibidem ii butts cont. unam perticam, in La Heele dimidium acre, in Sayleshmere unam acram, in Kyngestonn is Combs unam acram in duabus particulis, apud La Wayte unam acram dimid. in duabus particulis, in parte boreali de Ruggeway dimidium acre, in Kyngestonfeld unam acram di∣mid. in duabus particulis, in La Breche tres acras in duabus particulis, in Middelfurl unam acram, in Grenebaroghfurl dimidium. Et in campo Oc∣cidentali in Lottewellesfurl duas acras in duabus particulis, in [Fol. 131.] Middelfurl dimidium acre, in Burycrofte unam perticam, in Les Combs unam acram, in Whytelond in campo de Edwyn∣stonn dimidium acre, apud La Wayte unam acram in duabus particulis, in australi parte de
Ruggeway unam acram, in Horsladefurl unam acram in duabus particulis, apud Threthornes unam acram, in Lynyngsbarogh unam acram in duabus particulis. Et ulterius lanabit & tone∣bit bidentes Domini, & cum obierit dabie Do∣mino heriettam.

JOHANNES YONGE, de Ayshbury, tenet unum Messuaglum & dimidium virgate terre unde cur∣tillagium, gardinum & pomerium continent unam acram, & in duobus clausis annexis unam acram dimid. Item, tenet unum molendnum Aquaticum bladi super predictum tenementum. Item, tenet duas acras tres perticas in commu∣nibus pratis, unde apud Shephouse unam acram, in Wylleshmere unam acram, in Brokehmere dimi∣dium acre, in Wykehull iii swathis contin. unam perticam. Item, tent xxi acras dimid. terre arabilis in duobus campis, unde in campo Ori∣entali in Olond unam acram, in Darksfeld tres acras tres perticas in septem particulis, in Whyte∣lond duas acras in tribus particulis, super La Wayte unam acram in duabus particulis, apud Ruggeway unam acram dimid. In duabus parti∣culis, desuper Ruggeway duas acras in duabus particulis. Et in campo Occidentali in Hyllefurl duas acras in tribus particulis, in Middelfurl unam acram in duabus particulis, apud Heggeend dimidium acre, in Whytelond unam acram in duabus particulis, super La Wayte unam acram dimid. In quatuor particulis, in Ruggeway unam acram in duabus particulis, subtus Ruggeway duas acras in duabus particulis, desuper Rugge∣way unam acram, unam perticam in duabus par∣ticulis. Et ulterius lanabit & tondebit bidentes Domini, & cum obierit dabit Domino heriettam.

NICHOLAUS SMYTH, de Ayshbury, tenet unum Messuagium & unam virgatam terre & toftum i dimid. virgate unde curtillagium & gardinum insimul continent tres perticas dimid. Item, tenet octo acras & dimidium pertice prati in communibus pratis unde in Up-Mede duas acras, in La Hivea unam acram, in Shepeacre unam acram, apud Shepehouse unam acram, in North-Mede dimidium pertice. Item, tenet me∣dietatem unius Ihuyte in Wykehull cont. tres # acras per precium annuum xiid. Item, tenet xxxiii acras dimid. pertice terre arabilis in duobus campis unde in campo Orientali in Oldelond tres perticas dimid. in quatuor particu∣lis, in Darksfeld unam acram dimid. in duabus particulis, in Selleshmere unam acram, desuper La Broke unam acram dimid. in duabus particu∣lis, desuper La Quarr unam acram dimid. in du∣abus particulis, super Oldehull tres acras in dua∣bus particulis, apud Barethorn unam acram in duabus particulis, in Ruggewayfurl unam acram dimid. in duabus particulis, desuper Ruggeway unam acram, in La Breche unam # acram di∣mid. in Mandell dimidium acre, apud Rewthorne dimidium acre, apud Ruggewayes Crosse dimidi∣um acre. Item, ibidem unam acram, subtus Ruggeway dimidium acre. Et in campo Oc∣cidentali in Pekydlondfurl unam acram in duabus particulis, in Middelfurl [Fol. 133.] duas acras dimid. in tribus particulis, in boreali parte de Middelfurl unam perticam, in Hyllfurl unam acram, desuper Lortewell dimidium acre, juxta Whytecrosse dimidium acre, apud Heggeend dimi∣dium acre, in Whytelond duas acras in tribus par∣ticulis, in boreali pane de Ruggeway duas acras
in duabus particulis, in australi parte ejusdem tres acras in tribus particulis, in Horslade duas acras in tribus particulis, in campo de Kynge∣stonn dimidium acre. Et ulterius lanabit & ton∣debit bidentes Domini, & cum obierit dabit Domino heriettas duas.

JOHANNES LUCKYNG, de Ayshbury, tenet unum Messuagium & dimidium virgate terre unde curtillagium gardinum & pomerium con∣tinent unam acram. Item, tenet duas acras i stich prati in communibus pratis unde in North-Mede unam # acram, apud Upmedebuysh unam acram, in North-Mede i stich. Item, tenet un∣decim acras dimidium pertice terre arabilis in duobus campis, unde in campo Orientali in Olond unam perticam dimid. in tribus particulis, in Darksfeld dimidium acre in duabus particulis, juxta Drovehegee unam acram, in Whytelond unam acram, subtus Ruggeway unam acram, in Mandell unam acram, in Bofurl unam acram. Et in campo Occidentali apud Burycraftehegge duas acras in duabus particulis, in Middelfurl dimidium pertice, apud Lortewyll unam acram, in Rewthorne unam acram, & in campo de Kynge∣stonn unam acram, apud Stambrygge ii butts cont. dimidium pertice, & cum obierit dabit Domino heriettam.

Tota Villata de Ayshbury ii s. & Ed∣wynstonn iis. reddunt Domino pro pastura in Up-Mede, North-Mede, & Oldemershe, pro eorum Averiis inter festum Sancti Martinii, & festum Purificacionis Beate Marie Virginis reddendo iii per annum iiii s. ad quatuor terminos.

WILLIELMUS WYKS, tenet septem acras terre in separali ex opposito Cruci de Kyngestonn
per precium annuum xxiid. & scilicet valet acre viiid per annum.

Custodes bonorum Ecclesie de Ashbury, tenent Ixxxxiiii pedes in longitudinem & xviii pedes in latitudinem de solo vasto Domini ibidem ad usum & commodum Ecclesie predicte reddendo inde annuatim iiiid.

DIV2.Q: [Fol. 134.] Ayshbury.
DIV2.P: L. I. S.—Sedata inter Episcopum Sarisbu∣riensem, & Abbatem Glastoniensem, in Maneriis de Ayshbury & Buyshopstonn.

Anno Regni Regis HENRICI octavi duode∣cimo. In festo Sancti Luce Evangeliste istud decretum sive arbitramentum determinatum uit, ut sequentibus sequuntur, viz. cum quod lis diuturna vehemensque discordia non solum temporibus retroactis mote uerint verum eciam temporibus modernis indies magis ac magis ac∣crescant inter Tenentes Reverendi in Christo
Patris Domini EdmundiEdmund Audley Chancellor of the Garter. permissione divinâ Sa∣risburiensis Episcopi & Domini de Buyshopstonn in Com. Wiltes, ex parte una & tenentes Domini Ricardi Beerer eadem permissione Abbatis Glasto∣niensis, & Domini de Ayshbury & Edwynstonn in Com. Berk. ex altera parte super divisiones & bundas maneriorum predictorum in marisco & communia de Buyshopstonn, & Ayshbury ac Ed∣wynstonn, predictis tandem per amicabilem trac∣tatum cujusdam Magistri Edwardi Ffynche Doc∣toris supervisoris terrarum & dominiorum pre∣dicti Episcopi per prefatum Episcopum specialiter missi & electi, ac Fratris Thoe Suttonn, super∣visoris dicti Domini Abbatus Glastoniensis eadem de causa simili modo pro parte dicti Domini Ab∣batus missi & electi ad omnem ambiguitatem ex∣pellendam litemque & discordiam sedandam & reformandam ac finalem pacem secundum eorum discrecionem determinandum, qui qui∣dem Magister Edwardus Ffynche, & Thomas Sut∣tonn die & anno supra scriptis cum Tenentibus utriusque Dominii ad mariscum predictum ac∣cesserunt & visis bundis & limitibus ibidem ac eciam opinionibus & litigacionibus Tenencium utriusque partis nec non antiquis Evidenciis, bundarum & limitum diligenter perspectis, tan∣dem vero conquieverant in hunc modum, viz. Quod ubi tenentes utriusque Dominii nuperri∣me fecerunt foveas in diversis locis ex transverso marisci predicti nuncupati Dowles ad eorum li∣bitum, quod dicte fovee sive Dowles sic impro∣vise ac incaute incepte de cetero deleantur &
ad nichilentur ac nove sovee sive bunde fiant secundum ordinacionem & arbitrium predicto∣rum arbitratorum ad tunc & ibidem limitatorum. Et ad illud performandum elegerunt pro parte predicti Domini Episcopi quendam Johannem Russell portarium dicti Domini Episcopi, & Tho∣mam Gunwynn Clericum scaccarii dicti Domini Abbatis pro parte sua ad dictas novas bundas si∣tuandas qui quidem Johannes & Thomas posteriori die, viz. in crastino Sancti Luce Evangeliste anno supradicto cum tribus Tenentibus utriusque Do∣minii ad mariscum predictum accesserunt & so∣lum marisci predicti ex transverso ejusdem ma∣risci secundum determinacionem, & preceptum predictorum arbitratorum priori die assignato mensuraverunt, & novas foveas ac bundas per men∣suram predictam in diversis locis ex unanimi assen∣su statuerunt, & sic mariscum predictum diviserunt ac ulterius statuerunt, quod Tenentes utriusque Dominii dictas bundas sic divisas de novo fossa∣bunt claudentque cum plantis, vi. vi. s. situabunt & sufficienter harabunt ante festum Annunciaci∣onis Beate Marie Virginis proxime futurum, viz Tenentes predicti Domini Episcopi unam medi∣etatem in boriali parte marisci predicti & Te∣nentes dicti Domini Abbatis alteram medieta∣tem, viz. in australi parte. Ita quod si averia dicti Domini Episcopi & Tenencium suorum ma∣riscum dicti Domini Abbatis & Tenencium suo∣rum in defectu clausure dicti Domini Episcopi, & tenencium suorum intrent & depascent quod omnimodo per Ministros dicti Domini Abbatis impetrent & faciant rationabiles emendas, & simili modo si averia dicti Domini Abbatis, & Tenencium suorum mariscum dicti Domini
Episcopi, & Tenencium suoram intrent & de∣pascent ob defectum clausure dicti Domini Abbatis, & Tenencium suorum quod similiter per Ministros dicti Domini Episcopi impe∣trent & faciant rationabiles emendas alioquin non, &c.

THE Two following Papers, referring to a Transaction in P. 10. of Mr. ASHMOLE'S Life, coming too late, they could not be in∣serted in their proper Place; but as they are of a curious Nature, it is not thought proper to omit them entirely, but rather to place them here.

DIV2.OPENER: CHARLES REX, To our Trusty and Well-beloved Sir JOHN ROBINSON, Kt. and Bar. Lieutenant of our Tower of LONDON.
DIV2.P: OUR Will and Pleasure is, That you per∣mit THOMAS ROSS, and ELIAS ASH∣MOLE, Esquires, to speak with, and examine Hugh Peters, concerning our Books and Me∣dals that have been embezelled; and this to be performed in your Presence, for which this shall be your Warrant. Given at our Court at Whitehall, the 10th Day of September, 1660. in the Twelfth Year of our Reign.
DIV2.CLOSER: By his Majesty's Command, EDW. NICHOLAS.

DIV2.P: An Account of what Mr. Hugh Peters gave upon his Examination before the Honourable Sir JOHN ROBINSON, Lieutenant of his Maje∣sty's Tower, taken by Mr. Ross and Mr. ASH∣MOLE, assigned thereunto 12 September, 1660.

THE Examinant saith, That about the Year 1648. in August, he preserved the Library in St. James's, against the Violence and Rapine of the Soldiers, and the same con∣tinued Three or Four Months under his Cu∣stody, and that he did not take there any Thing, but left it unviolated, as he found it. He doth confess, that he saw divers Medals of Gold, Sil∣ver, and Brass, and other Pieces of Antiquity, as Iron Rings, and the like, but that he took no∣thing thence, and then delivered up the Key, and Custody of them, to Major General Ireton, and further he saith, That he never had or saw any Thing belonging thereto.
DIV2.CLOSER: Given upon Oath before JOHN ROBINSON, Lieutenant of the Tower. Hugh Peters.

1715 Nov. 22. Rich. Lyford of Rush Dean, Es{que}
1716 Nov. 12. John Dodson of Cookham, Es{que}
1717 Dec. 21. Edw. Richards of Compton, Es{que}
1719 Jan. 6. Rich. Thompson of Cooley, Es{que}

DIV1.P: N. B. The Sheriff of every Year is nomina∣ted at the latter end of the last, to serve for the next Year.

DIV1.HEAD: ADDITION to the Family of LATTON, mentioned in Page 336, 337, &c, of the 3d Volume, and is a more exact Pedigree of the Family than that printed there.

LIST.ITEM: ROgerus de Latton, Com. Wils, sans dat.

Johannes de Lat∣ton, 33° Ed. filii Hen.
Isabel

lhel. de Lat∣ton de Up∣ton, Com. Berks, 18 E. 2. 1325.
Joan, fil. de Percy.

Johan. Latton de Upton, Berks, T. E. 2.
Agnes fil. de Estbury.
Wileimus Latton de pton, I E. 3. 1326.
Johannes Latton de Up∣ton, Com. Berks.
Johannes Latton de Up∣ton, T. E. 3.
Thom. Latton de Upton, T. H. 6.
Wilb. Latton de Chilton, Com. Berks, T. E. 4.
Johan. Latton de Chilton. T. H. 7.
Wilhel. Latton de Chilton, T. H. 8.
Johan. Latton de King∣ston-Bagpuze, Com. Berks, T. E l. ob. Nov. 1596. sepult. Dec. 13.
Wilhelmus Latton de Kingston, T. Jac.
Thomas Latton de King∣ston, T. Car. 1.
Johan. Latton de King∣ston, Berks, de Rich∣mond Park, & de Eshar-Place, Com. Surrey, T. C. 2.
Wilhelmus Latton, fil. Johannis, cui prol. & Masc. An. Christi Incarnat. 1718.

DIV1.HEAD: ADDENDA TO NEWBERY, MENTIONED In Page 288. of the 2d Volume, taken from an MS. in the Posses∣sion of THOMAS RAWLINSON, of the Middle Temple, Es{que} F. R. S. and taken more Notice of in Page 29. of the 3d Volume.
[Page 52.] Parcell. Possessionum nuperi Monasterii de Wherwell.
DIV1.P:
Newbery.]FIRMA omnium illorum trium Messuag. ac horr. & gardin. adjac. prope le Warres in Newbery pred. modo vel nuper inten. sive occupatione Ricardi Underwood, vel assign. sui, sic demiss. Ricardo Okeham Gen. inter al. per literas Patentes Domine nuper Regine Eliz. sub magnó sigillo Anglie dat. xxix die Junii, An°. Regni sui ximo. habend. a fest.
Sancti Mich. Archangeli tune proxim. fut. pro term, lx ann. omnibus reparacionibus premissis ad onus dict. firm. & assignat. suis duran. term. predict. reddend. inde ad fest. Annunc. Beate Marie Virginis, & Sancti Michaelis Archangeli equaliter—Past in Fee simple.
The Messuages in Newbery per ann. xls. are past in Fee simple to George and William Whit∣more, by Indenture dated January 10. 1611.

DIV1.HEAD: ADDENDA to ABINGTON, men∣tioned in page III. of the First Volume, taken from an MS. Docquet Book of the Grants of Privy-Seals during the Reign of King HENRY VIII. in the Possession of THOMAS RAWLINSON of the Middle Temple, Esq; and F. R. S.
Anno Hen. 8. 11. Anno Dom. 1511.
DIV1.P: REX 23 die Januarii concessit Thome Halys, Willielmo Bireley, Johanni Walker, & aliis Magistris Fraternitatis sive Gilde Sancte Crucis de Abendon in Com. Berk, infra Ecclesiam Sancte Elene ibidem ac fratribus & sororibus ejusdem. Quod ipsi & successores sui habeant unam feriam apud Abendon, sigulis annis duraturam, videlicet in festo Sancti Andree Apostoli in die proximè precedenti ac in die proximè sequenti.

DIV1.HEAD: VERUM EXEMPLAR Insignium Epitaphiorum, Venerandaeque Antiquitatis INSCRIPTIONUM aliquot In omnibus Ecclesiis, & aliis Locis BERCHERIENSIS COMITATUS; Anno ab Incarnatione Domini 1666, Ibidem existens.
Per ELIAM ASHMOLE, Armig. Windesorii Heraldum ad Arma, Deputatum Marescallumque: Ab EDOVARDO BYSSHE, Milite, Armorum Rege, Clarenieux, Pro Comitatu praedicto.

DIV3.HEAD: PURLEY.
DIV3.P: ON the South Side of the East Window of the Chan∣cel, is a Monument set in the Wall, having this In∣scription in Capitals.

Q.P: HERE LYES THE BODY OF ANNE, THE WIFE OF EDWARD HYDE, OF THE MIDDLE TEMPLE, LONDON, ESQ; AND DAUGH∣TER OF SIR GEORGE AYLIFFE, OF GRETENHAM, IN THE COUNTY OF WILTS, KNIGHT, WHO DYED ON THE 2d DAY OF JULY, IN THE YEARE MDCXXXII, AGED 20.
VALE ANIMA CANDIDISSIMA, VALE MARITI TUI, QUEM DOLORE ET LUCTU CONFICIS, AETER∣NUM DESIDERIUM, VALE FOE MINARUM DECUS, ET SAECULI ORNAMENTUM.

DIV3.P: Above the Inscription are the Arms of Hyde and Ayliffe, &c.
Underneath is the decumbent Pour∣traiture of a Woman, resting on a Death's Head, having the Figure of a Child in Swaddling-Cloaths, lying before her Bo∣som.

Q.P: On a Monument on the South-Wall of the Chancel, is this Inscription.

JANA, Filia & Haeres JOHANNIS IWARDBY, Equitis Aurati, Domini hujus Manerii de PURLEY, castissima JOHANNlS SAINT-JOHN Conjux pientissima, demum vidua velata; Ejusque duo ex NICHOLAOSAINT-JOHN Nepotes, Pronepotes Michael & RICHARDUS, sub beatae Resurrectionis spe hic requiescunt.
SACRUM hic Memoriae pie posuit JOHANNES SAINT-JOHN Miles & Baronettus, dictae JANAE quartus Haeres.

DIV3.P: In the East Window of the Chancel are the Pictures of St. Mark, and St. John the Baptist, &c.

Q.P: Upon a Grave-Stone at the Entrance into the Chancel, is this Inscription.
Here lyeth the Body of RICHARD WATS, late Re∣ctor of Purley, in the County of Berks, Master of Arts in Trinity Colledge in Cambridge. He died the Anno Domini, 16... Aged 78 Yeares.

DIV3.P: On the North Side of the Chancel up∣on a Brass-Plate, fixed in a Grave-Stone, is this Inscription.
DIV3.Q: Here lyeth WILLIAM NOBLE Son of Thomas Noble of Rearsbye, in the County of Leicester, Preacher of the Word of God, late Parson of Brookeby, and Vicar of Queeneburrough in the said County, who died the 6th of October, Anno 1644.

DIV3.HEAD: TIDMARSH.
DIV3.P: Is a Rectory in the Deanery of Read∣ing, Incumbent the Reverend Mr. Kirkby.
At the upper End of the Body of the Church lyes a Grave-stone, in the Middle whereof is fasten'd a Brass Plate, whereon is engraved the Pourtraiture of a Person armed, without any Inscription.

Near adjoyning is another Grave-stone, whereon is fixed a Brass Plate, and there∣on is engraved the Figure of a Woman in the Habit of the Times wherein she lived, and under her Feet is this Inscription.
DIV3.Q: Hic jacet Margareta, que fuit Vxor Thome Wode, unus Iusticiar. Dom. Regis de Communi Banco, quondam Vxor Roberti Leyneham, Armig. Domini istius manerii, que obiit quinto Die Decembr. Anno Domini, 1499. Cujus anime propicietur Deus. Amen.

DIV3.HEAD: BRADFIELD,
DIV3.P: Is a Rectory in the Deanery of Reading, Patron is Mr.Tomson(who has a Seat here) Incumbent the Reverend Mr. Bond.
Upon a Blue Stone, laid towards the West End of the Church, is this lnscription.
DIV3.Q: Here lyeth buried the Body of BENJA∣MIN DAVIS, Son of Benjamin Da∣vis, of London, deceased the 23d of September, Anno Domini, 1663. Aetat. suoe 4 years 27 Days.

DIV3.HEAD: ENGLEFEILD, or rather INGLEFEILD,
DIV3.P: Is a Rectory in the Deanery of Reading, Patron the Reverend Mr. N. Wright, In∣cumbent the Reverend Mr.Yate. Here is a Seat belonging to Sir Charles Inglefeild.

On the North Side of the Chancel is a fair Grey Marble Monument erected, at the Head whereof (in Plates of Brass) is the Pourtraiture of a Knight, kneeling, in compleat Armour; over which is a Surcoat of his Arms.
Behind him are the Figures of his five Sons, kneeling; his Wife was also drawn kneeling before another Faldstool, placed over against him, but the Brass is now torn away.
Out of the Knight's Mouth proceeds this Scrole.
DIV3.Q: O bone Jesu, tu novisti et potes et vis bonum animabus nostris, nos ner novimus, nec possumus.
DIV3.P: Out of the Lady's Mouth.
DIV3.Q: Tu pro pietate tua ineffabili nobiscum dis∣pones, secundum quod no∣veris tibi velle et nobis prodesse.
DIV3.P: That Part of the Epitaph inscribed under the Figures, and which yet re∣mains is as follows: Here lyes Sure Thomas Englefilde—Margery his Wyffe, the whyche Sure— The 3d Day of April, the Yere of our—Vc. & xiiii on whos Soulles Thesu have—
On the North Side of the aforesaid Monument are these Arms painted, viz. of Englefild and Danvers, Englefild and Fortescue.
Upon a blue Marble, laid in the Mid∣dle of the Chancel, is this Inscription.

Q.P: Here lyeth buried MARTHA, Daughter of Sir William Welby, of Gedny in Lincolnshire, Kt of the Bath, and virtuous Wife of Doctor GILB. WIMBERLEY, by whome he had seaven Children. She dyed Dec. 5th. 1645, Aetat. suae 43.

Siste; sacer Locus est, tumulata Martha exuit Ossa, Chara Deo, cunctis{que} bonis, quibus urna superbit, Dilecti cineres, non sic requiescitis urna, Post mortis morsum vivetis glorificati Gia sperne spenta, Gia anchora sperne Sic deplorat & implorat Relictus ejus Gil. Wimberley.

DIV3.P: On a Grave-stone, near the South Side of the Chancel, is this Inscription.
DIV3.Q: Here under lyeth buried the Body of John Howseman, Clerke, who was sometime Master of the Temple in London, Vicar of Caneudon, in Essex, and at his Death, Parson of Engle∣field: who departed this Life the 25th Day of April, 1588. Anno Reg. Eliz. 30.
DIV3.P: Upon another Grave-stone, near the Entrance into the Chapel, on the North Side of the Chancel, is this Inscription.
DIV3.Q: Here lyeth the Body of Mary Wal∣ton, Wife of Henry Wal∣ton, Gent. and Daughter of Thomas Eyre of Hylowe, in the County of Derby, Es{que} who dy'd in Childbed, Sept. 19. Anno 1636.
DIV3.P: In the North Window of a Chapel, situate on the North Side of the Chancel, is this written upon the Glass, in Black Letters.
DIV3.Q: This Chapel was builded in the Year of our Lord, MVCXIIII.
DIV3.P: At the Right Side of the East Window, on the Wall, are fixed Plates of Brass, whereon is engraved the Figure of a Judge in his Robes, kneeling at a Faldstool, with Three Sons behind him. Opposite to him are the Effigies of his Wife (with a Surcoat of her Arms over her Habit) kneeling in like manner, and Nine Daugh∣ters behind her. Out of the Judge's Mouth proceeds the following Scroll.

Q.P: Benedic anima mea Domino, & om∣nia que intra me sunt nomini sancto ejus.
Benedic anima mea Domino, & noli oblivisci omnes retributio∣nes ejus.

DIV3.P: Out of the Lady's Mouth proceeds this Scroll.

Q.P: O beata benedicta & gloriosa Trini∣tas, Pater, & Filius, & Spiritus Sanctus:
Tibi laus, tibi gloria, tibi gratia∣rum actio.

DIV3.P: Under the aforesaid Figures, is this Epitaph.

Q.P: Here lyeth Sir Thomas Englefyld, Kt. Son and Heir to Sir Thomas Englefyld, Kt. hereby lying; and one of the King's Iustices of the Comyn Place; and Dame Elizabeth his Wyffe: the whych Sir Thomas decessyd the XXVIII. Day of September, in the Yeare of our Lord God MCCCCCXXXVII.
On whose Soule, and all Crysten Soulles, Ihesu have Mercy.
Amen.

DIV3.P: In the North Wall of the said Chapel, is a Brass Plate fastned, and thereon in∣sculped the Pourtraiture of a Man in Ar∣mour, with his Wife lying by him; and at the Bottom, this Inscription.

Q.P: Here lyeth buried John Englefield, Es{que} Second Son of Sir Thomas Englefield, Kt. Who had to Wife. Margaret Fitton, Daughter to Sir Edward Fitton of Gowsworth, By whom he had One only Child, named Francis, yet living; who married Jane, Eldest Daughter to Anthony, now Viscount Mountague; and had Yssue by her Foure Sons and One Daughter.
The said Margaret, after she had lived a Widow 38 Yeares, caused this Mo∣nument to be made in the Yeare 1605, in Remembrance of her said Husband, who dyed the First Day of April, 1567.

DIV3.P: On a White Marble, fixed in a Black Marble Grave-stone, under the said Plate in the Wall, is this inscribed.
DIV3.Q: Here lyeth buried JOHN ENGLEFIELD, Es{que} And MARGARET his Wife; Whose Monument is on the North Side of this Chapel: Which Margaret dyed the 29th of August, 1612.
DIV3.P: In the aforesaid North Chapel, and against the North Wall, is erected a fair Monument, having thereon the Pour∣traitures of a Knight in Armour, and his Lady, both kneeling at a Desk; behind him kneel Four Sons, behind her One Daughter. Upon the Side of the Desk are the Arms of Englefield and Browne impaled. Under the said Marble Mo∣nument, lies a Stone, and thereon fixed a Brass Plate, thus engraved.

Q.P: Here lyeth interred the Body of Sir Francis Englefeyld, Bar.

(Only Child of John Englefeyld, Es{que} and Margaret his Wife)
Who marriedJane, Eldest Daughter of ANTHONY BROWNE, Eldest Son of Anthony Viscount Mountague; by whom he had Yssue Ten Children, viz. Thomas, Dorothy, Francis, Thomas, John, Anthony, William, Mary, Margaret, and Henry; of which Thomas the Elder, Dorothy and John, dyed before their Father. He dyed the 26th Day of October, Anno Dom. 1631. Being 69 Yeares, 3 Moneths, and 27 Days old.

DIV3.P: Upon another Marble Grave-stone, laid in the said Chapel, is engraved this Epitaph.

Q.P:
Dominus GULIELMUS ENGLEFYLD, Domini FRANCISCI ENGLEFYLD, Equitis & Bar. & Dominae Joannae Browne, Filius quartus, Mortalitat is suae exuvias, usque ad Dei Judicis adventum, hic deposuit; pristinae Religionis Fidei, in Regem amoris, in Patriam pius & constans observator: Maritus conjugem, Parens filiam unicam sed non solam
quippe quam Dominus FETIPLACE Matrimonio antea conjunxerat, Germanos fratres omnesque Natos & familiares maerere reliquit.
Anno Salutis reparatae MDCLXII. 17. Aprilis. Aetatis 53. Conjugii—Viator, Manibus ejus bene praecare, salutis non immemor tuoe, vive & vale.

DIV3.P: Under the North-East Window of the aforesaid Chapel, lyes the Body of Sir Francis Englefield, Bar. He was buried in May, 1665. in the Grave where for∣merly Sir Edward Norris had been inter∣red.
In the Body of the Church, near the Entrance into the Chancel, is engraved on a Black Marble, the following Inscription.

Q.P: Under this Stone is interred the Body of GRACE, Daughter to JOHN JOYLIFFE, Es{que} in Dorsetshire, and dear and pious Wife of Mr. HUMPHRY DRAKE, who by her had one Child.
She dyed August the 31st 1658. Aetatis suae anno 39.

Q.L: Quae precibus petiit, sublimia contigit arva,
Viva Deum coluit, viva Deo fruitur.
Complevit multos, paucos numeret licet annos
Aetas longa audit, quae bona vita brevis.

DIV3.P: In an Arch of the South Wall of the Church, is cut in Stone the Pourtraiture of a Knight lying cross-legged, in Armour of Mail; over which, is a loose Coat girt close to him.
At the Head of the aforesaid cross-leg∣ged Monument, is the Pourtraiture of a Woman veiled, cut in Wood, lying also within another Arch.

In the said South Isle, near the Entrance into the Church, is a Grave-stone, where∣on is fixed a Plate of Brass, and thereon the Figure of a Man, drawn in a Gown, and under him an Inscription, as follows.

Q.P: Hic jacet Philippus Englefeld, Armig. Dominus de Inglefeld, qui obiit IX. die Julii, Anno Dom. MCCCCXXXIX. Cujus anime propicetur Deus.
Amen.

DIV3.P: On a Marble Grave-stone, laid higher in the said Isle, is the Pourtraiture of a Man cut in a Brass Plate, habited in a Gown, with Pouch at his Side, and holding up his Hands in the Posture of praying; at his Feet is this Epitaph in old black Characters.
DIV3.Q: Hic jacet Johannes Englefild, filius & heres Roberti Englefild Generosi, qui obiit XXVI die Febr. An. Dom. MCCCCLXIV. Cujus anime pro∣picietur Deus. Amen.
DIV3.P: Near the East End of the South Isle is yet remaining part of an Epitaph engra∣ved on a Brass Plate, set on a Grave-stone, under the Figure of a Woman in the Habit of the Times, viz.
DIV3.Q: Here lyeth buried Dame.......... Wyff of Edward Paytowe....... Dowghter of Thomas Th........ his Wyff the wyche Dame...... Anno Domini, MDXXX.
DIV3.P:
In the same Isle is there another Grave-stone, and thereon in Brass Plates the Fi∣gures of a Woman kneeling, and four
Daughters behind her, and underneath them, this Inscription.
DIV3.Q: Hic jacet Susanna Burdet, xor Humfridi Burdet, Generosi, ac unius filiarum Thome Englefild, Militis defuncti, que quidem Susanna, obiit II die Septembris, Anno Domini, MDLXIX. cujus anime propici∣etur Deus. Amen.
DIV3.P: On a fair Black Marble Stone, is this Inscription.

Q.P: HUIC TUMULO, Mortales suas Exuvias credidit, Immortali digna memoriâ Heroina HONORA de BYRGHO.

Richardi Comitis Clanricard, & Franciscae Wal7s;ingham, filia unica; JOANNIS Marchionis WINTONIENSIS Conjux secunda: Quatuor filiorum, trium Filiarum Parens; Mulier juxta pia, fortisque: quam nec laetio Fortuna efferre, nec longa series adversae frangere, aut flectere potuit. Obiit x Martii, MDCLXI. vixit Annos 51. Menses 6. Dies 19.

DIV3.P: On another Black Marbel adjoyning to the former, is this Inscription.

Q.P: Hic situs est, JOHANNES PAWLETT, Johannis, Marchionis Wintoniensis, & Honorae de Burgho, ex Marchionibus de Clanricard, filius primogenitus egregiae spei adolescens: At! O quam brevis & caduca mortalium spes est! Ut Coelesti horreo innocentiae messem inferret, Juvenis aestate moritur.
Cave viator illum e saxo metiri quo capitur, Heroem nusquam minus quam in urnareperies, Obiit xi Junii MDCLX. vixit Annos 22. Menses 4. Dies 18.

DIV3.P: On another Black Marble adjoyning to the former, is this Inscription.

Q.P: Aureae cavete mentes! avara mors est; animas rapit pretiosas: Furti conscius lapis his custodit Aeternitati HONORAM PAWLETT, Joan. March. Vint. & Honorae de Burgho, ex Marchionibus Clanricard, Filiam natu minimam.

Praeeuntem Fratrem Solstitio aestivo, soror Brumali secuta est ipso natali Christi Domini die, Virginem Forma, genere, moribus, virtute, praestantem Terris coelum invidit,
& Mundi periculis praereptam, in tuto reponere curavit.
In pacem beatorum beata quiescat anima: vixit Annos 21. Menses 5. Dies 6. Obiit 25 Decembris, MDCLX.

DIV2.HEAD: WOLHAMPTON,
DIV2.P: Is a Vicarage in the Hundred of Theale, in the Deanery of Reading.

In the North Side of the Chancel lyes a stone Coffin, and over it a Black Mar∣ble, made broad at the Head, but grow∣ing narrower towards the Feet, and round, near the upper edges, is engra∣ved as followeth, in Saxon Characters this Inscription.
DIV2.Q: Hic: jacet: Ricardus, de Herclond Rector: Hujus loci conditor Ca∣pellan.

DIV2.HEAD: ALDERMARSTON,
DIV2.P: This Town is situate in Theale Hun∣dred, in the Deanery of Reading, on the Banks of the River Kennet, and near it on a rising Ground, stood a fair Manor House: It was first given by King Hen∣ry I. to Robert Achard, from whose Po∣sterity, by the Delameres, it descended to the late Owners, the Forsters, a very anti∣ent and gentile Family, one of whom, Humphry Forster, Es{que} was High-Sheriff of this County in 1475. a lineal Ance∣stor of Sir Humphrey Forster, last of that Race: It is now sold to the Lord Sta∣well and Sir..... Smith, but the Ad∣vowson is still in the Gift of Queen's Col∣lege in Oxford.

At the Entrance into the Chapel, si∣tuate on the South Side of the Church, is erected a fair Alabaster Tomb, whereon are laid the Pourtraitures of a Knight in Armour, (his Collar composed of a Knot, and an S'S alternately, with a Portcullis pendant thereto) his Lady lying by him, drest in the Habit, usually worn in her Life time. The Crest, whereon his Head resteth, is a Fox's Head, issuing out of a
Crown, with a Fawn under his Feet.

On the North Side of the Monument are the Pourtraitures of 8 Sons in Armour, standing; on the South Side of 8 Daugh∣ters in their usual Habits; and at the Feet are 3 Sons more; round the upper Ledge is this Epitaph engraved.
DIV2.Q: Here lyeth Sir George Forster, Kt. Son and Heire of Humfry Forster, Es{que} Cozen, and of the Heires of Sir Stefyn..... Kt. and Eli∣zabeth, Wyfe of the same Sir George, Daughter and Heire of John Delamare, Es{que} Son and Heire of Thomas Delamare, Kt. Which Elizabeth dyed the VIIth Day of December, in the Yeare of our Lord God, MDXXVI. and which Sir George dyed in the Yeare of our Lord God.......
DIV2.P: Engraved on a Brass Plate, nailed on a Blew Marble, lying in the said chapel, near the aforesaid Monument, is this In∣scription.
DIV2.Q:
Here lyeth William Forster, Es{que} Lord of Aldermarston, Son and Heire of Sir Humfrey Forster, Kt. and Jane his Wife, one of the
Daughters of Sir Anthony Hun∣gerforde, of Downe-Amney, Knt. which William deceased the Xth Day of January, Anno Domini, MDLXXIV. and his said Wife, the....... Day of....... An. Domini.
DIV2.P: Beneath the Inscription are cut the Fi∣gures of eight Sons, and...... Daughters.
On another Grave-stone placed in the middle of this Chappel, is this Inscription.
DIV2.Q: Here lyeth the Body of ANNE, Daughter of WILLIAM FORSTER, Es{que} who dyed in her Infancy, and was here buried, January the xiith. MDCLIV.
DIV2.P: On a raised Monument, adjoyning to the South Wall of the said Chappel, is a Brass Plate fastened, having thereon engra∣ven, the Pictures of four young Maidens, each less in Stature than the other, and under them this Inscription.
DIV2.Q: Dedicated to the precious Memory of the Four virtuous Sisters, Daughters of Sir HUMPHRY FORSTER, Baronet, and of ANNE his Wife, viz. ANNA, who dyed May xvi. MDCXXXVIII. aged 18 Yeares and 5 Moneths. MARY dyed Sept. ix. MDCXXXVIII. aged 14 Yeares and 10 Moneths. BRIDGET dyed May xxix. MDCXXXVII. aged 10 Yeares and 1 Moneth. And MARGARET, who dyed February xix. MDCXXIII. aged one Yeare and 6 Moneths.
DIV2.P: Near hereunto is a fair Marble erected under the South Window, by the Lady Anne Forster, during her Life-time, and on it is this Inscription.
DIV2.Q: Here lyeth the Lady ANNE FORSTER, Wife to the late Sir HUMFRY FORSTER, Knight and Baronet, and had Yssue 16 Children.
DIV2.P: On the South Side of the Chancel is a Chapel, having a Vault under the same lately made; and wherein lye the Bodies of Sir Humfry Forster, Knight and Baronet; and of William Forster, his Son and Heir.
Over the Entrance into this Chapel hangs a Tablet, where, in a Lozenge are impaled the Arms of Forster and Steward together, with their Quarterings.
DIV2.Q: Arms painted in several Windows belong∣ing to Aldermarston House.
DIV2.P: In the Glass Windows of the With∣drawing Room.

LIST.ITEM: Sir Humfrey Forster, Kt. and Baronet.

DIV2.P: In the upper Windows of the Hall.

LIST.ITEM: Popham and Souch of Deane imp.

DIV2.P: In the lower Windows of the Hall.

DIV2.HEAD: UFTON, alias UFFINGTON,
DIV2.P: Is a Rectory in the Hundred of Theale, and Deanery of Reading.

Towards the East End of the Chancel, on the North Side, is raised a fair and large Stone Monument, where the Statues of Richard Perkin, Es{que} and the LadyMervyn, his Wife, were made kneeling before a Desk, but are now broken down.

Lower, on the same Side of the Chan∣cel, is another large Arched Monument of Stone, erected against the Wall; and within the Arch lies a Man in Armour, and his Wife on his left Side; and under them this Inscription.
DIV2.Q: HIC JACET FRAN. PERKINS. Si genus a proavis spectas, (pie Lector) ab illis Bissenus fuit hic, quem lapis iste tegit. Si virtus candorque parent Encomia terris. His habet, aut coelis proemia, certus habet. Jungitur hoc tumu'o, quem struxerat ANNA Marito, Corpora divisit Mors, sociavit Amor.
DIV2.P: On the Front of this Monument are the Figures of two Sons.
Near to the said Monument is laid a Marble Grave-stone, having a Brass Plate, with this Inscription.
DIV2.Q: FRANCISCUS PERKINS, filius Francisci & Margaretae, Patre vivente Mortuus, & hic sepultus, Anno Dom. MDCLX. aetatis vero suae 38.
DIV2.P: In a Chapel adjoyning to the North Side of the Chancel, is a raised Monument, over which lies a large Stone of Touch, and this Inscription.

Q.P:
Hic jaceo FRANCISCUS PER∣KINS, filius & haeres Franc. & Annae qui supra jacent; duxi MAR∣GARETAM filiam Johannis Eyston de Catmer Armigeri, ipsa genuit mihi
sex filios, filiasque decem, amboque sub hoc marmore contegimur.
Viximus unanimes, Tumulo sociamur in uno, Una sit ut requies, det Deus una salus. Obiit decimo non Septembris, Anno MDCLXI. aetatis suae 79.

DIV2.P: On a Plate of Brass, fixed on a Marble Grave-stone, lying on the North Side of this Monument, is this Inscription.
DIV2.Q: FR. PERKINS, MARGARETAM Uxorem alloquitur: In Pace requiesce (dilectissima Conjux,) & paulisper expecta adventum meum, quod si diutius mansero, hoc divino obsequio, non vitoe desiderio obsessum obtestor. Obiit primo die Martii Anno, MDCXLI. aetatis suae 55.
DIV2.P: Engraven on another Plate of Brass, fastened in a Marble Grave-stone lying Eastward in the said Chapel.
DIV2.Q:
Hic jacet corpus GULIELMI SMITH, Generosi, qui ex hac vita migravit decimo tertio Die Novembris, Anno Domini, MDCXXVII. aetatis Septuaginta annorum & hic jacet per illum CONSTANTIA Uxor ejus, fisia GEORGII TETERSHALL
Armigeri: Illa Defuncta, Anno Domi∣ni, MDCXX.

DIV2.HEAD: SULHAMSTED ABBOTS,
DIV2.P: Is a Rectory in the Hundred of Theale, Deanery of Reading, and Patronage of Queen's College in Oxford.
On the North Side of the Chancel, on a Brass Plate fixed on a little Blew Stone, is this Inscription.

Q.L: Extremum vitae finem meditare Viator,
I am cito cum videas omnia nata mori.
In Coelum con verte oculos, complectere laudem,
Damnosasque Evae despice blanditias,
Radulphus Flyer, Rector Ecclesiae Parochialis
De Sulhamsted Abbot, jugiter de morte
Cogitans, sibi vivens hoc Monumentum
Posuit, Anno Salutis, MvCXXIIII.

DIV2.HEAD: BURFIELD,
DIV2.P: Is a Rectory in the Hundred of Theale, Deanery of Reading, and Patronage of the present Duke of Shrewsbury.

At the Foot of the North Wall of the Chancel, lyes an antient Pourtraiture in
Wood, of a Knight armed in Mail, over which is a Coat close girded about him, and cross-legg'd.

On the South Side of the Chancel is an Alabaster Monument, raised but very little from the Ground, whereon lyes the Pourtraiture of a Man in Armour, and his Wife by him, drest in the Habit of the Times, without any Inscription.
In the Chapel adjoyning to the South Side of the Chancel.
On a fair raised Monument in Brass Plates, are the Figures of a Man in Ar∣mour, lying between his two Wives, drawn in their usual Habit; and under their Feet these Verses.

Q.L: Of Worthy Williams Corps, Death hath wrought the nde,
Who in his Lyfe so followed Laws and Love;
That of the House from which he did deseend,
Was none more just in any Time before.
His And by good Advice, and helping Hand at neede,
His Neighbours found, ae ready at request:
His Travel was amongst them for to breede,
Such Means as might them keepe in Love and Rest.
Another like to him right hard it were to finde,
His Dertues such to all Men did appeare,
We may well say, which do remaine behinde,
He was too good to dwell among us here.
O! Worthy Williams, thy Country both bewaile,
That Death hath Power from us thee to dissever;
We can no more but wish to thine availe,
That Lyfe elsewhere, the which shall last for ever.

DIV2.Q: Nicholas Williams, Esq; dyed the first of April, MDLXVIII. and of Age 36 Years, who had 2 Wives, Elizabeth and Mabell; by the first Wife one Daughter, named Rason; and also by his last Wife one Daughter, named Sara: And also here lyeth buried Richard Williams. Gentleman, Brother to the said Nicholas, who dyed the Tenth Day of the same Moneth, Anno. MDLXVIII.
DIV2.P: Under the South Window of this Cha∣pel, is another raised Monument, the top Stone of which had Brass Plates, and thereon were cut the Figure of a Man in Armour, and his Wife lying on his Right Hand, without any Inscription.

DIV2.HEAD: STRATFIELD-MORTIMER,
DIV2.P: Is a Manor in the Possession of Eton College, in the Hundred of Theale, and Deanery of Reading, bordering on the fa∣mous, antient Roman Station at Silchester in Hampshire, and is under the Patronage of Eton College.
All the Sides of the East Window of the Chancel are bordered with the royal Bad∣ges of the Star, and Welch Royal Arms.
On a Grave-stone placed in the North Isle, in a Plate of Brass fixed, having a Man in Armour graved thereon, is this Inscription.
DIV2.Q: Hic jacet Richardus Trevet, alias ictus Halywode Walectus, qui obiit XIX die Januarii, Anno Domini, MCCCCXLI. cujus a∣nime propicietur Deus. Amen.
DIV2.P: In the South Isle of the Church, on a Grave-stone, is this Inscription.

Q.P: Here lyeth the Body of THOMAS HEADLAND, who lived in God's Feare, and dyed in God's Faithe; and he hath ordained by his Will, to be given every Year unto the Poor of Mortimer in Berkshire, Twelve Dozen of Bread upon St. Thomas the Apostles Day, unto the World's end.
He departed this Lyfe the vith of April, An Dom. Let no Man judge of me, for as I am so shall thou be. MDCXXXIX.

DIV2.P: At the Entrance of the Chancel, on a Black Marble Grave-stone is this Inscrip∣tion.
DIV2.Q: For a Memorial of my first Love, and pious Husband, William Dring, M. A. of Queens College, Oxon, late Vicar of Stratfield-Mortimer, who deceased the xiith of February, MDCXLVII. and was here interred the xiiith Day of the same Moneth. I Jane Newlin have layed this Marble.

DIV2.HEAD: COMPTON Hundred. ALDWORTH.
DIV2.P:
ALDWORTH is a Vicaridge in the Deane∣ry of Newbury, and in the Patronage of St. John's College in Cambridge, formerly remarkable for being the Lordship of the antient Family of De la Beche, who had a Castle here; and, whose Heirs Male
were extinguished in the Reign of Ed∣ward III. and are supposed to be interred under the Monuments underneath men∣tioned: One of this Family was High Sheriff of this County in 1313. The Heiress of this Family was afterwards married into the Name of Whitlock.
In the Wall, at the East End of the North Isle, is a Statue of one in Armour, in Free-Stone, lying on one Side, and one Arm broke off.
In the middle lies another Statue, cross legged, armed.
At the West End another Statue like the former.
Within an Arch on the South Side of the Church, is another like the former.
Within another Arch, next the last mentioned, lyes the Statue of a Woman holding up her Hands in a praying Po∣sture. All these Statues are of a very large Size.

DIV2.HEAD: COMPTON,
DIV2.P: Is in the Deanery of Newbury, former∣ly belonged to the Pyles, one of whose Family, Francis Pyle, Esq; was created a Baronet, September 12. 1628.
In the middle of the Body of the Church, lies a Grave-stone, whereon is a Plate of Brass, cut with the Figure of a Man in a Gown, and his Wife in her usual Habit, and at their Feet this Epitaph.
DIV2.Q: Of your Charitie pray for the Soules of Richard Pygott, and Allys his Wife, on whoe Soules, and all Christian Soules, Jhesu have Mercy.

DIV2.HEAD: East HILDESLEY, alias HESLEY,
DIV2.P: Lyes in the Road from Oxford to New∣bury, and had Lords of its Manor former∣ly, of the same Name.
Near the Entrance into the Church Eastward, are three Seats, at the Ends whereof are the Arms belonging to the Family of Hildesly cut in Wood.
In the middle of the North Isle, of a Grave-stone is fixed a plate of Brass, and thereon Figure of a Woman engraved, and these Verses.
DIV2.Q: Anno MDCVI JAN. vii. Defuncti, defuncta jaces HILDESLEIA conjux, Conjug is & viduae corpora marmor habet, Tu decies trinos GULIELMI proeteris annos, Octoque his superans lustra peracta cadis, Altera ab undecimo soboles cui parta parenti est, Tres nati, natae quatuor, inde manent. Eque is virgineâ radians KATHERINA coronâ, Nata minor matri, marmore grata fuit.

DIV2.HEAD: MORTON Hundred. ASHAMPSTED.
DIV2.P: Near the Entrance into the Chancel lyes a small Grave-stone of Touch, and thereon is cut this Inscription.
DIV2.Q: Here lyeth the Body of Edward Pococke, Husband of Mary Pococke, he departed this Lyfe the xxivth of March, Anno Dom. MDCLXV.

DIV2.HEAD: BASSILDEN.
DIV2.P:
Under the East Window of the Chancel lies a Grave-stone, at the Head whereof, in a Brass Plate, are the Figures at full
length of an aged Man in Armour, and a Woman drest in her usual Habit, having her little Son by her, and beneath their Feet this Inscription.
DIV2.Q: Here lyeth the Bodies of ROGER YOUNG, Es{que} and WILLIAM YOUNG, Son and Heir apparent unto the said Roger, Esq; which Ro∣ger, after he had continued in the Com∣mission of Peace in the County of Berks, without any Intermission, full 60 Yeares, departed this Life at Bassilden, the iiid of March MDLXXXIX. aetatis suae 96. William, the Son of Roger, taking to Wife KATHARINE BARKER, second Daughter of WILLIAM BARKER, of Sunning, in Berks, Es{que} by whome he had WILLIAM, sole Yssue of their Bodies, departed this Lyfe the xxivth of March MDLXXXIV. aeta∣tis suae 26.
DIV2.P: In the Body of the Church lies a Grave∣stone, upon which are engraved in Brass the Figures of a Man in a Gown, with a Pouch hanging at his side; and his Wife drest in the Fashion of her Times, underneath is this Epitaph.
DIV2.Q: Hic jacet Johannes Clerke & Lucia Vxor ejus, qui quidem Johannes oviit VI die Jul, Anno Domini, MCCCCXCVII. quorum anima∣bus ac animabus puerorum suo∣rum propicietur Deus. Amen.

DIV2.HEAD: STREATLEY,
DIV2.P: So called from Stratum, the Roman Road running through this Town to Spine, or Speen, in this County,
Is in the Hundred of Morton, Deanery of Wallingford, and Patronage of the Bi∣shop of Sarum.
On a Plate of Brass, set in a Marble, laid at the Entrance into the Chancel, are the Figures of a Man in a Gown, and his Wife, habited according to the Times, and thus.
DIV2.Q:
Here lyeth the Body of THOMAS BURITON, of Streatly, in County of Berks, Es{que} Son and Heire of WILLIAM BURITON, who was third Son to THOMAS BU∣RITON, of the City of Hereford,
in the County of Hereford, Es{que} This Thomas here buried, took to Wife JOHAN WIER, Gentlewoman, by whome he had six Sons and two Daughters; the Sons dyed all in the Lyfe of the Father, the which JOHAN surviving her sayd Husband, in Testi∣mony of her intire Affection, which she did be are to him living, placed this Stone in his Memory being dead; in∣tending as she lived with him, so after her Death, by God's Permission, to rest in the same Grave. The said Tho∣mas dyed the xxth of July, An. Dom. MDCIII. and the said Johan dyed Credo videre bona Dom. in terr viventium.
DIV2.P: In the Chancel is the Figure of a Man in a Cloak, and his Wife in her usual Habit, engraven in Brass upon a Marble Grave-stone, and beneath them this E∣pitaph.
DIV2.Q:
Here lyes buried Thomas Clarke of Streatley, Gent. and Elizabeth his Wife, one of the Daughters and Co∣heires of Griffith Barton, Es{que} they had Yssue betweene them one Son, cal∣led Griffith, and three Daughters,
Agnes, Elizabeth, and Margaret; she died the xth of Sept. MDXCVIII. and he dyed the viith of May, MDC.
DIV2.P: At the Feet of Thomas Clarke is the Fi∣gure of his Son Griffith, and under his Wives Feet of his three Daughters, all like wise engraved in Brass Plates.
On a Grave-stone near adjoyning, where∣on is the Picture of a Woman cut in a Brass Plate, with this Inscription.
DIV2.Q: Here lyethe the Body of Mrs. Margaret Beryngton, the Wife of Mr. William Beryngton, Gent. which Margaret deceased the XXVth Day of June, in the Year of our Lord God, MDLXX. ha∣ving a stedfast Hope of a joyful Resurrection.
DIV2.P: On another Plate fixed in a Grave-stone is this Inscription.
DIV2.Q: Here lyeth the Body of Griffin Clarke, Son of Thomas Clarke of Streatley, and of Elizabeth his Wife; which Griffin deceased in the Yeare of our Lord God, MDLXXXIII.
DIV2.P: Engraved on another Brass Plate, is the Figure of a Woman, with a Child in swad∣ling Clothes at her side, and under them is this Epitaph.
DIV2.Q: Hic jacet Elizabetha, filia Ricardi Osborn de Streatley, Armigeri, & quondam Vx. Johannis Prout, Mer∣catoris Stapuli Calicie, que obiit parturiendo in die Epiphanie, An. Dom. MCCCCXL. cujus ani∣me propicietur Deus. Amen.

DIV2.HEAD: CHOLSEY,
DIV2.P: Is in the Hundred of Reading, and Deanery of Wallingford, and a Vicaridge, of which Mr. Saul is present Incumbent.
Engraved in a Brass Plate, on a Blue Grave-stone lying in the middle of the Chancel, is this Inscription.
DIV2.Q: Hic jacet Dnus Johannes Gate, Vic. de Cholsey, qui obiit vicesimo I die Julii, Anno Domini, MCCCC. Nonagesimo quarto; cujus ani∣me propicietur Deus. Amen.
DIV2.P: On another Grave-stone lying Westward of the former, is engraved on a Plate of Brass this Inscription.
DIV2.Q: Orate pro anima Johannis Mere, quondam Vicarii istius Ecclesie, qui obiit XIII die Junii, Anno MCCCCLXXI. cujus anime pro∣picietur Deus. Amen.
DIV2.P: In the South Isle, on a Brass Plate set in a Grave-stone, is this Inscription.
DIV2.Q: Ici gist Johan Barfoot de Cholsey, que moruet le VIII jour d' Octob. I'an∣de grace, MCCCLXI. I'alme de qi Dieu eyt Mercy.
DIV2.P: In the North Cross of the Church is a∣nother Grave-stone, and thereon engraved in a Brass Plate this Epitaph.
DIV2.Q: Of Your Charite pray for the Sowles of John Willmott, and Agnes his Wife, on whos Sowles Lord have Mercy.

DIV2.HEAD: WALLINGFORD Town.
DIV2.P:
This Town borders on Oxfordshire, a∣bout a Mile from the Isis, which parts the Counties of Berks and Oxford; said to have been the Metropolis of the Attre∣batii, and called by Antoninus, Calleva; by Ptolomy, Callena; whereas, according to Mr. Cambden, it is called Gallena, and to be derived from Guallhen, a Word signifying in the old British, The old Fort. It is said to have been the Royal Mansion of Comius, constituted King of the Attre∣batii by Julius Caesar; and to prove this Hypothesis, much weight is laid on two Coins, said to have been discovered here, bearing the Inscriptions of REX CALLE. and REX COM. and upon the Authority of this, the Place is supposed to have been of Note in the Roman Days, as it was certainly in the Times of the Saxons and Danes. This Notion of its Grandeur in the Roman Times, has been sufficient∣ly, and learnedly confuted by Dr. Gale, who has proved, without Contradiction, Henley, a Market Town on the Borders of Oxfordshire, to be the true Calleva, p. 109. of his Edition of Antoninus's Itinerary. Others have fixed this Calleva at Oxford,
but with as little shew of Reason: But to proceed to Times less dark and obscure, we are assured, that this Town was de∣stroyed by Danish Power in 1006. and that afterwards, in the Confessor's Days, it was esteemed a Borough, mentioned in Domesday Book, and at the Norman Con∣quest, the Seat of one Wigod. Here the Conqueror accepted the Submission of Stigand, Arch-Bishop of Canterbury, and married Wigod's Daughter, Aldith, to his great Favourite, Robert d' Oyley, who by her had Issue one Daughter, named Maud, whom he married to Miles Crispin in 1084. and endowed her with this Castle, Town, and Honour. She was married a Second Time to Brian Fitz-Count, a brave Loy∣alist, who held out a Siege of this Castle for his Mistress, the Empress, or Queen Maud, against the perjured Usurper Ste∣phen, till a Peace was concluded here be∣tween Stephen, and her Son Henry II. Not long after King Henry's Accession to the Throne, These two entered on a Religious Life. Upon which this Estate and Manor was seized, and by Richard I. given to his Brother John, whose second Son, Richard King of the Romans, celebrated his Espou∣sals with Senchia, Daughter to Beatrix, Countess of Provence, in this Place, where on St. Caecilia's Day, he entertained the
King, Queen, and Nobility. This Ma∣nor he left to his Son Edmund, Earl of Cornwall, on his Death in 1271. who in 1281. founded in this Castle a Collegiate Church, dedicated to St. Nicholas, and endowed it with an Estate for the sup∣port of a Dean, 6 Prebendaries, 6 Clerks, and 4 Choristers: It fell in the general Havock, and at the Dissolution was ra∣ted at 147 l. 8 s. An.

This Manor in after Times became the Plunder of the two Favourites of Edward II.
